page.title: 08VILLAGE BLACKSMITH
page.content: Mr. John Stronach lives in the small hamlet of Bowershall, which lies two miles north of Dunfermline.He is the fifth generation of the Stronach family to work as a blacksmith. He has seen many changes in his trade in the last thirty years.Formerly he shod the horses such as Clydesdales which worked on the surrounding farms. Today these have been replaced by machinery and most of his trade is concerned with horses used for leisure. He uses mainly ready made shoes of mild steel which are shod cold.This enables him to travel throughout Fife to carry out his trade. He buys his shoes from a steel whole-saler in Perth.
